DataElement.preferredName: MBSImP Component 2 Tongue Control During Bolus Hold Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric score for the assessment of tongue control during bolus hold in the oral impairment section of the Modified Barium Swallow Impairment Profile.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Modified Barium Swallow Impairment Profile Oral Impairment During Swallowing Impairment of Tongue Control During Bolus Hold
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An evidence-based, standardization of the Modified Barium Swallow Study in adults. The protocol assesses 17 critical components of swallowing and provides an objective profile of the physiologic impairment affecting adult swallowing function._An assessment of an individual's oral impairment during swallowing._An observation of an individual's tongue control during bolus hold.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An evidence-based, standardization of the Modified Barium Swallow Study in adults. The protocol assesses 17 critical components of swallowing and provides an objective profile of the physiologic impairment affecting adult swallowing function.

Concepts.definition: An evidence-based, standardization of the Modified Barium Swallow Study in adults. The protocol assesses 17 critical components of swallowing and provides an objective profile of the physiologic impairment affecting adult swallowing function.

Property.preferredName: Oral Impairment During Swallowing Impairment of Tongue Control During Bolus Hold
Property.preferredDefinition: An assessment of an individual's oral impairment during swallowing.:An observation of an individual's tongue control during bolus hold.

Concepts.definition: An assessment of an individual's oral impairment during swallowing.

Concepts.longName: Impairment of Tongue Control During Bolus Hold
Concepts.definition: An observation of an individual's tongue control during bolus hold.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: MBSImP:Modified Barium Swallow Impairment Profile, Martin-Harris et al., 2008
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for Princess Margaret study in Rave as requested by D.Lawrence. mc 6/8/16

ValueDomain.preferredName: Tongue Control During Bolus Hold Score
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Posterior Escape of Greater Than Half of Bolus

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Posterior Escape of Greater Than Half of Bolus
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding of posterior escape of greater than half of bolus during swallowing.

Concepts.longName: Posterior Escape of Greater Than Half of Bolus
Concepts.definition: A finding of posterior escape of greater than half of bolus during swallowing.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Posterior Escape of Less Than Half of Bolus

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Posterior Escape of Less Than Half of Bolus
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding of posterior escape of less than half of bolus during swallowing.

Concepts.longName: Posterior Escape of Less Than Half of Bolus
Concepts.definition: A finding of posterior escape of less than half of bolus during swallowing.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Escape to lateral buccal cavity/floor of mouth (FOM)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Escape to lateral buccal cavity/floor of mouth (FOM)
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding of escape to lateral buccal cavity/floor of mouth during swallowing.

Concepts.longName: Escape to Lateral Buccal Cavity/Floor of Mouth
Concepts.definition: A finding of escape to lateral buccal cavity/floor of mouth during swallowing.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cohesive Bolus Between Tongue to Palatal Seal

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cohesive Bolus Between Tongue to Palatal Seal
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding of cohesive bolus between tongue to palatal seal during swallowing.

Concepts.longName: Cohesive Bolus Between Tongue to Palatal Seal
Concepts.definition: A finding of cohesive bolus between tongue to palatal seal during swallowing.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
